subsections.title: A. God is Holy
subsections.content: God is separate from and exalted above His creation. He is morally pure, perfect, and untainted by sin.

subsections.title: B. God is Righteous and Just
subsections.content: God always does what is right and acts in accordance with what is right. He is the perfect judge.

subsections.title: C. God Loves
subsections.content: God's love is perfect, sacrificial, and eternal. His love is demonstrated through His actions toward His people.

subsections.title: D. God Has Wrath
subsections.content: God's wrath is His righteous anger and opposition to sin. It is a holy and just response to rebellion against His righteousness.

subsections.title: A. Man is Created in God's Image
subsections.content: Humans are uniquely made in the image of God, giving them dignity, purpose, and the capacity for relationship with God.

subsections.title: B. Man Has Sinned
subsections.content: All humanity has fallen into sin and rebellion against God, corrupting every aspect of human nature.

nestedSubsections.title: 1. All Have Sinned
nestedSubsections.content: Every person without exception has sinned against God.

nestedSubsections.title: 2. The Results of Sin
nestedSubsections.content: Sin brings separation from God, spiritual death, and ultimately physical death.

subsections.title: C. Man Cannot Save Himself
subsections.content: Humans are completely unable to earn salvation or make themselves right with God through their own efforts.

subsections.title: A. Who Jesus Is
subsections.content: Jesus Christ is fully God and fully man, the eternal Son of God who became incarnate.

nestedSubsections.title: 1. Jesus is God
nestedSubsections.content: Jesus Christ is truly and fully God, equal in essence with the Father and the Holy Spirit.

nestedSubsections.title: 2. Jesus is Man
nestedSubsections.content: Jesus Christ is truly and fully human, born of a virgin, yet without sin.

subsections.title: B. What Jesus Did
subsections.content: Jesus lived a perfect life, died a substitutionary death, and rose again from the dead.

nestedSubsections.title: 1. Jesus Lived a Perfect Life
nestedSubsections.content: Jesus lived without sin, perfectly fulfilling God's law and righteousness.

nestedSubsections.title: 2. Jesus Died
nestedSubsections.content: Jesus died on the cross as a substitute, bearing the punishment for sin that we deserved.

nestedSubsections.title: 3. Jesus Rose from the Dead
nestedSubsections.content: Jesus physically rose from the dead on the third day, demonstrating His victory over sin and death.

subsections.title: A. Repent
subsections.content: True repentance involves a change of mind that leads to a change of direction - turning from sin to God.

subsections.title: B. Believe
subsections.content: Saving faith involves trusting in Jesus Christ alone for salvation, relying completely on His finished work.

subsections.title: A. Forgiveness
subsections.content: God completely forgives all sin - past, present, and future - for those who trust in Christ.

subsections.title: B. Righteousness
subsections.content: God declares believers righteous and credits Christ's perfect righteousness to their account.

subsections.title: C. Reconciliation
subsections.content: The broken relationship between God and humanity is restored through Christ's work.

subsections.title: D. Eternal Life
subsections.content: Believers receive the gift of eternal life, beginning now and lasting forever.

subsections.title: E. Adoption
subsections.content: Believers become children of God, part of His family with all the rights and privileges that entails.

subsections.title: A. God's Promise
subsections.content: God has given His word and promise that those who believe in Christ have eternal life.

subsections.title: B. The Holy Spirit's Witness
subsections.content: The Holy Spirit bears witness with our spirit that we are children of God.

subsections.title: C. Changed Life
subsections.content: True salvation results in a transformed life, evidenced by spiritual fruit and growth.

subsections.title: A. God's Keeping Power
subsections.content: God's power keeps believers secure in their salvation; they cannot lose what God has given them.

subsections.title: B. Christ's Intercession
subsections.content: Jesus Christ continually intercedes for believers at the right hand of the Father.

subsections.title: C. The Holy Spirit's Seal
subsections.content: The Holy Spirit seals believers as God's permanent possession until the day of redemption.

subsections.title: A. The Word
subsections.content: Spiritual growth comes through regular study and application of God's Word.

subsections.title: B. Prayer
subsections.content: Prayer is essential for spiritual growth, providing communion with God and spiritual strength.

subsections.title: C. Fellowship
subsections.content: Christians need regular fellowship with other believers for encouragement and growth.

subsections.title: D. Witnessing
subsections.content: Sharing the gospel with others is both a privilege and responsibility of every believer.

subsections.title: A. Spiritual Gifts
subsections.content: Every believer has been given spiritual gifts by the Holy Spirit for service in the body of Christ.

subsections.title: B. The Body of Christ
subsections.content: All believers are part of the universal church, the body of Christ, and should serve together in unity.

subsections.title: C. Good Works
subsections.content: Believers are called to do good works as a result of their salvation, not to earn it.

subsections.title: A. Expect It
subsections.content: Believers should expect to face trials and suffering in this life as part of following Christ.

subsections.title: B. God's Purpose in It
subsections.content: God uses suffering for His glory and our good, conforming us to the image of Christ.

subsections.title: C. How to Respond
subsections.content: Christians should respond to suffering with faith, hope, and dependence on God's grace.
